title: 106_s1849
content:
The Act may be cited as the "White Clay Creek Wild and Scenic Rivers System Act". It includes findings related to the Act. Congress finds that Public Law 102-215 directed the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study of White Clay Creek and its tributaries for potential inclusion in the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. As part of the study, a watershed management plan was prepared in 1998 to protect the area's values and resources. After a study of White Clay Creek and its tributaries, Chester County, Pennsylvania, New Castle County, Delaware, Newark, Delaware, and 12 Pennsylvania municipalities passed resolutions supporting the White Clay Creek Watershed Management Plan and endorsing the designation of the creek and its tributaries for inclusion in the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. After a study and support from various counties and municipalities, White Clay Creek and its tributaries are designated for inclusion in the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. Section 3(a) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act is amended to include White Clay Creek in Delaware and Pennsylvania, totaling 190 miles of river segments to be administered by the Secretary of the Interior. This includes specific segments designated for recreational use. White Clay Creek in Delaware and Pennsylvania is designated as a recreational river, scenic river, and recreational river for various segments totaling 25.8 miles. The White Clay Creek in Delaware and Pennsylvania is designated as a recreational river, scenic river, and recreational river for various segments totaling 25.8 miles. It includes different branches and sections flowing through the White Clay Creek Preserve and State Park. The White Clay Creek in Delaware and Pennsylvania is designated as a recreational river for various segments totaling 25.8 miles, including different branches and sections outside the boundaries of preserves and parks. Middle Run Natural Area includes 5.2 miles of Middle Run as a scenic river, 15.6 miles of Pike Creek, and 38.7 miles of Mill Creek designated as recreational rivers. SEC. 4. BOUNDARIES.

The boundaries of the designated segments of White Clay Creek and its tributaries will be 250 feet from the ordinary high water mark on both sides.

SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION. The designated segments of White Clay Creek and its tributaries will be administered by the Secretary of the Interior in cooperation with the White Clay Creek Watershed Management Committee as outlined in the Management Plan. The Management Plan satisfies the requirements for a comprehensive management plan under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act. Cooperative agreements will be established for long-term protection, preservation, and enhancement of the designated segments. The Secretary will offer a cooperative agreement with the White Clay Creek Watershed Management Committee for the protection, preservation, and enhancement of designated segments as outlined in the Management Plan. The federal role in management is outlined in Section 6. The Director of the National Park Service will represent the Secretary in implementing the Management Plan and the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act for designated segments. The Secretary may provide assistance, including technical support and funding up to $150,000 per fiscal year. The cooperative agreements for designated segments must align with the Management Plan and may include financial assistance from the United States. Any segment not in the National Park System shall not be considered part of it or managed by the National Park Service under this Act. The designated segments must align with the Management Plan and may receive financial assistance from the United States. Segments not in the National Park System will be managed by the National Park Service or subject to its laws and regulations. State and local zoning laws and ordinances in effect at the time of this Act's enactment will satisfy the standards under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act for the designated segment. The Federal Government is prohibited from acquiring any land or interests along the designated segments for the purpose of implementing the Act.
